title: Stock Column
intro: In the Stock column, you can view the stock available for every PO item or inventory item.

title: LWS Column
intro: In the LWS column, you can view the sales performed during the last week for every PO item.

title: Inbound Column
intro: In the Inbound column, you can view the inbound stock (number of items added to POs that are still due) for every PO item.

title: ROQ Column
intro:
In the ROQ column, you can view the recommended order quantity for every PO item.
The formula for calculating the ROQ value is:

((Last Week Sales / 7) * Suppliers Lead Time in Days) â€“ Inbound Stock

title: Item Cost
intro: By clicking the blue figures on any cell within the Cost column, you can set the PO item's cost.

title: Item Discount
intro:
By clicking the blue figures on any cell within the Discount column, you can set the PO item's unitary discount value. It supports fixed values and percentages.
Also, if you click on the 'Set default discount link', the discount saved in the supplier's profile will be applied.

title: Item Quantity
intro: By clicking the blue figures on any cell within the Quantity column, you can set the PO item's units you need to purchase.

title: Item Tax
intro:
By clicking the blue figures on any cell within the Tax column, you can set the PO item's tax. It supports fixed values and percentages.
Also, if you click on the 'Set default tax link', the tax saved in the supplier's profile will be applied.

title: Item Actions
intro: The actions menu will show up some useful actions that will vary depending on the displayed item (Add Meta, Remove, Create New Inventory, Set Purchase Price, etc).

title: Add Products
intro: Click on the 'Add Product(s)' button to open the modal that you can use to add one or multiple products and/or inventories.

title: Add Fee
intro: Click on the 'Add Fee' button to open the modal that you can use to add a fee item. You can specify its name, the cost and if you want it to be a fixed value or a percentage from the total.

title: Add Shipping
intro: Click on the 'Add Shipping' button to open the modal that you can use to add a shipping cost. You can specify its name, the cost and if you want it to be a fixed value or a percentage from the total.
